member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Products.Docking.SR
member.summary: Provides access to the string resources of this assembly, also allowing for their customization.
member.remarks:
Call the method to return a resolved resource string. If a custom string has been set for a specified string resource name, it will be returned. Otherwise, the default string resource value is returned.
If any of the resource strings are customized via a call to , it is best to do so before any other classes in this assembly are referenced, such as in the application startup.

member.summary: Converts source values to a value for the binding target. The data binding engine calls this method when it propagates the values from source bindings to the binding target.
member.param: The array of values that the source bindings in the produces. The value indicates that the source binding has no value to provide for conversion.
The type of the binding target property.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: A converted value. If the method returns null, the valid null value is used. A return value of . indicates that the converter did not produce a value, and that the binding will use the if it is available, or else will use the default value. A return value of . indicates that the binding does not transfer the value or use the or the default value.

member.summary: Converts a binding target value to the source binding values.
member.param: The value that the binding target produces.
The array of types to convert to. The array length indicates the number and types of values that are suggested for the method to return.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: An array of values that have been converted from the target value back to the source values.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.ToolWindowTransitionSelector
member.summary: Implements a that has been designed especially for usage with docking tool windows.
member.remarks: If no user-transitions are specified, it will push the tool window content one way or the other depending on which tool window's tab was clicked. This selector will also not perform a transition if the right mouse button is down, since the transition may interfere with context menu display.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.ToolWindowTransitionSelector.SelectTransition(ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.Animation.TransitionPresenter,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns a based on custom logic.
member.param: The that is managing the transition.
The element from which a transition is occurring.
The element to which a transition is occurring.
member.returns: Returns an application-specific to apply; otherwise, null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between windows that are snapped together via magnetism.
member.value: The distance between windows that are snapped together via magnetism. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: If this value is greater than 0, there will be a gap between windows that are snapped together when magnetism is enabled by the property.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.MagnetismSnapDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance at which magnetism begins to snap windows being dragged.
member.value: The distance at which magnetism begins to snap windows being dragged. The default value is 5.
member.remarks: If this value is greater than 0, magnetism is enabled. Set it to 0 to disable magnetism. Magnetism tries to snap corners of a window being dragged to other window corners around it. Increase this property's value to increase the range over which the magnetism will work. Magnetism also takes effect when resizing via window borders.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.UseHostedAutoHidePopups
member.summary: Gets or sets whether auto-hide popups should be hosted within the bounds of the dock site.
member.value: true if auto-hide popups should be hosted within the bounds of the dock site; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks:
This value should be false only in Windows applications where you expect to host Windows Forms controls in your MDI area. If you do not plan on hosting Windows Forms controls, leave it true.
When false, flyout close animation is disabled.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.DockSite.UseHostedRaftingWindows
member.summary: Gets or sets whether rafting windows should be hosted within the bounds of the dock site.
member.value: true if rafting windows should be hosted within the bounds of the dock site; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Due to security restrictions with the Window class in XBAPs, when used in an XBAP, a value of true will be forced.

member.summary: Resizes the slots based on the specified ratios, if any.
member.param: This list of zero or more desired ratios.
member.remarks: If contains 0-1 items, then the slots will be resized equally. Otherwise, the specified ratio will be applied to the associated slot (i.e. the slot that shared the same index). member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Docking.ToolWindow.GetDirectionRelativeToWorkspace
member.summary: Returns a indicating where the tool window is located in relation to the .
member.returns: A indicating where the tool window is located in relation to the .
member.remarks: If the tool window is open in a Document state, Direction.Content is returned. If the tool window is open in an AutoHide state, a direction indicating the auto-hide dock side is returned. If the tool window is open in a Docked state and a workspace is in use in the dock site (no tool window inner-fill), a direction indicating the location of the tool window relative to the workspace is returned. Otherwise, Direction.None is returned.
